document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Health Education - Kindergarten

EA14FEF230A9477DB367FD803D0DDF48.description: The student understands how various factors can influence decisions regarding substance use and the resources available for help. The student is expected to role play refusal skills and how to get help from a parent or trusted adult in unsafe situations involving the use or misuse of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

1CDACE80A51642CFBE7AF5BFDD8CE8B3.description: discuss the harmful effects of alcohol, tobacco, and drugs on physical health.

0B7A32D142104C259901F4A2343767B4.description: discuss the proper usage of medications; and

85833E4210E146B1922DBFCE7D81F1B3.description: The student understands the difference between the use and misuse of different substances and how the use and misuse of substances impacts health. The student is expected to:

51817E7E5268452BA22B2816923AB8EF.description: explain how to get help from a parent or trusted adult when made to feel uncomfortable or unsafe by another person.

F8911F46A8394681A95217B201A84E9E.description: describe appropriate actions to take in response to bullying such as telling a parent or a trusted adult; and

FC2FCDF073A54CBC95A72F1B26D36ECA.description: identify bullying behaviors and the role of the bystander;

D5A880BB577C4B6198084971E21EC352.description: The student understands the impact of interpersonal violence and the importance of seeking guidance and help to maintain personal safety. The student is expected to:

3E110CA243544BF1806731F68CB17059.description: The student understands how to be a safe and responsible citizen in digital and online environments. The student is expected to identify situations when one should get help from a teacher, parent, or trusted adult when made to feel bullied, uncomfortable, or unsafe in a digital or online environment.

2F7F12B6B16947529CEF52E05EB5B87A.description: name objects that may be dangerous such as knives, scissors, and screwdrivers and explain how they can be harmful.

4C6AA198C0694406AB347DB69593EA37.description: The student understands that individual actions and awareness can impact safety, community, and environment. The student is expected to:

AA1568F935114938A2CFDEEA13F08A31.description: identify personal space and appropriate boundaries.

C8DB03F34A4040C3BFB6674F11CE71D0.description: identify and role play refusal skills such as saying "no" to protect personal space and to avoid unsafe situations and practice telling a parent or trusted adult if threatened; and

5AA2C1528BA34C70920A217E1B8E65E6.description: identify roles and characteristics of a trusted adult;

DE934DDFD52144658D11888EBB1DF243.description: The student differentiates between healthy and unhealthy relationships and demonstrates effective strategies to address conflict. The student is expected to:

A72509E23C5C4D039A0AE205A3683EE5.description: identify the purpose and demonstrate the proper use of protective equipment such as seat belts, booster seats, and bicycle helmets.

FA0CC3231DB44D339093A0886F34985D.description: discuss and demonstrate procedures for responding to emergencies, including reporting to a parent or trusted adult or contacting 911; and

586201063AAF4E73B780A8C2A5F88F2E.description: The student identifies and demonstrates safety and first aid knowledge to prevent and treat injuries. The student is expected to:

7AE319BEEB774A28BC29513EA866DA32.description: identify habits that help individuals stay healthy such as getting the proper amount of sleep and daily physical activity.

2EAA6E82169F490880F8D08A2F853FB1.description: describe basic facts of food allergy safety such as not sharing food and explain the importance of respecting others who have allergies; and

80EA16E72C5D4D9EBFAF51C4247D37FE.description: The student identifies and explains risk and protective factors related to healthy eating and physical activity. The student is expected to:

9505FEA7D31F462AA64E551835BE4876.description: identify healthy and unhealthy snack choices.

E991F550EAE94901825F7F96AF7E1085.description: identify types of foods that help the body grow, including fruits and vegetables, dairy, and protein; and

9B11263AC25048D19BEAA757BC11DDF7.description: identify healthy portion sizes for common food items;

9CBF3833B96F49868AA1E76ED4FEC31D.description: demonstrate an understanding that the human body is composed mostly of water and explain the importance of drinking water daily;

4F0643E039AE4D4E9C98E1EFDEFC5467.description: The student identifies and explains healthy eating strategies for enhancing and maintaining personal health throughout the lifespan. The student is expected to:

819D7A5ADB644EAE997861A5F3309900.description: The student develops and uses appropriate skills to identify and manage conditions related to mental health and wellness. The student is expected to discuss how to treat peers with different learning needs with dignity.

E852B38A6B154B4C8681BC7BA03088D6.description: discuss the meaning of goals and identify at least one health-related goal.

5B6905A020FD40A4B6B0180746FF400E.description: describe positive social skills and personal qualities such as truth, kindness, reliability, and respectfulness; and

5772327FF10047EB8F2CE14FC3105B38.description: The student develops the capacity for self-assessment and evaluation, goal setting, and decision making in order to develop a healthy self-concept. The student is expected to:

3316607FABD94F1682AF15B3A4647EAB.description: identify and practice ways to solve conflicts with a friend.

F22B1995BF8C4A7AA48543A94F5C71B6.description: demonstrate respect and communicate appropriately with individuals; and

FFA28E724F4A449095C92DDBBD9B82C9.description: demonstrate skills for making new acquaintances;

04467D6F56CF4D7E8010293FE4836504.description: discuss how friends can influence a person's behavior;

B0CC42B5741F43B886659C74EC3ED190.description: describe and practice calming and self-management strategies;

9C63546E7E58404A8D3D15D25D05E625.description: identify their own feelings and emotions;

052FBC20923D4D53B43AF03ACA2D4501.description: The student identifies and applies strategies to develop socio-emotional health, self-regulation, and healthy relationships. The student is expected to:

401769B41FB84F759659A24116BBA1BD.description: identify head lice and biting insects that may cause illness and their proper removal and care.

ED116A34B11F4D9D9BFE3B50187BE95E.description: discuss ways in which germs are transmitted, methods of preventing the spread of germs, and the importance of immunization; and

2339379D1545456DA3C1369C73E0935B.description: identify personal hygiene and health habits that help individuals stay healthy such as hand washing and brushing teeth;

48C4316574974E8AB6800EF0AC8348B2.description: name people who can provide health care guidance such as parents, family members, trusted adults, teachers, and health care professionals;

4489EAF3C91D4ECDA9D517B2D45E6CF4.description: The student understands health literacy, preventative health behaviors, and how to access and evaluate health care information to make informed decisions. The student is expected to:

EE4E0DBFB0884508B83B50ECF94A008F.description: The student examines the structure, function, and relationships of body systems and their relevance to personal health. The student is expected to name the five senses.
